img.br: Dillon Middle School's very own Olivia Kailey and Brooklyn Williams were a part of history yesterday, February 5, 2020, during the final impeachment vote for our nation's third impeachment trial. Olivia and Brooklyn traveled to Washington, D.C. in representing the Be The Change Youth Coalition from Beaverhead County. These young ladies met Senator Tester, Senator Daines, Senator Kennedy, Congressman Gianforte, the Speaker of the House, and many more. In addition, Olivia and Brooklyn rode the underground train, visited the cloak room, and rode the Senator's only elevator. These ladies proudly represented our school and community of Dillon during their time in Washington D.C. and we couldn't be more proud!

td.br: As Red Ribbon Week approaches at Dillon Middle School, I wanted to take the time to put out a tremendously valuable online resource for parents and community members that I came across lately. This website provides a toolbox of pictures, information, and research on items to stay alert for in regards to the use of e-cigarettes (vaping). "Vaping" is drastically on the rise by teens in our nation, state, AND community. The old saying of "it takes a village to raise a child" falls right in line with our responsibility to educate ourselves in this extremely dangerous practice among teens. If you have any questions regarding this topic or resource, please feel free to stop by or contact me at (406) 683-2368, option 2.
